text: The 2017 Western Australian state election happened on 11 March 2017 to elect the 40th Parliament of Western Australia, including all 59 seats in the Legislative Assembly and all 36 seats in the Legislative Council. Western Australian Electoral Commission (WAEC) ran the election The incumbent Liberalâ€“National Coalition government, led by Premier Colin Barnett and Brendan Grylls, tried to win a third term in government. They were defeated by the Labor Party, led by Opposition Leader Mark McGowan, in a landslide. ==References== Category:2017 elections Category:Elections in Western Australia
title: 2017 Western Australian state election
